channel.title: Ian Wootten’s Blog
channel.description: Ian Wootten is a Software Developer in Cardiff, UK. He helps companies solve complex problems with simple software. He uses tools like Python, Terraform and Serverless to deliver solutions and iterate quickly.

item.title: Self Hosting Generative Open Graph Art on the Edge with Supabase
item.description: I show you how you can make unique, randomised open graph images using generative art and then self-host them using Supabase and Fly.io

item.title: How to Create a Python Virtual Environment By Hand
item.description: Learn how much your favourite venv manager automates away when it creates virtual environments by creating your own by hand.

item.title: Building a Link Curation API with Platformatic
item.description: I show you how simple creating an API can be using Platformatic. I create a link curation API for my newsletter and even get it deployed with very little effort.

item.title: One Does Not Simply 'pip install'
item.description: Find your favourite package and turn to the readme to get it installed - it seems dead simple just a ‘pip install’ away. Nothing could possibly go wrong. Right?

item.title: How to Add a Ghost Signup Form to Another Site
item.description: After migrating my newsletter from Revue to Ghost, I needed to modify my static Astro blog here to allow people to subscribe. It involved a couple of steps, here's how you can do it too.

item.title: The Peerless Assassin SE 120 is an Incredible $40 Cooler
item.description: I recently upgraded my Personal PC's CPU to a 5800x, requiring me to upgrade my cooler to something more substantial.

item.title: The 2022 Retrospective
item.description: We are into the final few days of 2022 and as any good dev should I wanted reflect on how I think it's gone for me.

item.title: Why You Probably Shouldn't Develop Your Own Digital Product Store
item.description: At first glance, building a store for your own digital products seems simple to a developer. Hook up a Stripe payment link for orders and get it a to ping a webhook. Capture order details, email, deliver product. Job done. But it can be a whole more complex than that....

item.title: Using ChatGPT to Create Spoiler-Free Advent of Code Hints
item.description: I don't find the 'hints' on the AoC subreddit that useful, so I decided to ask ChatGPT if it could generate them for me

item.title: Automatic Spotify Playlist Creation with Pipedream and Supabase
item.description: Every week I create a new version of my site mixes.it based on new DJ mixes that have been released. In this post I describe how I collect the data with Pipedream and Supabase to create Spotify Playlists from it.

item.title: How to Setup Distrobox on the Steam Deck
item.description: I tried out coding with Distrobox on the Steam Deck and discovered it fixes most of my problems with it.

item.title: How to Upgrade Your Steam Decks Storage
item.description: I recently upgraded my Valve Steam Deck from a paltry 64GB eMMC to a somewhat less paltry 256GB SSD, saving me about £120

item.title: How to Search Your Entire Twitter Archive With One Line of jq
How to Use Underscores with Github Pages
Coding on the Steam Deck
item.description: I got the Valve Steam Deck last month and have instantly become obsessed with it. I wanted to know if I could use it as a linux dev machine, knowing that it was essentially a full blown PC under the hood.

item.title: Python isn’t Used in Prod
item.description: I watched a video earlier this week by comedian and mathematician Matt Parker. It’s an entertaining walkthrough of some impressive optimisation of his own Python code by his community but there's a comment about Python that I thought warranted some pushback.

item.title: PyCon UK 2022
item.description: This past weekend I've been attending PyCon UK. I'm particularly lucky in that I live a 10 min train ride from where it is located in Cardiff meaning its incredibly convenient and economic for me. As a Python dev located here, there's literally no excuse not to attend.

item.title: Getting Poetry to use the active Pyenv to Create a Virtual Environment
item.description: I found with a new poetry install that it refused to use the pyenv version of Python.

item.title: Developing on the Framework Laptop
item.description: Earlier this year I bought the 11th gen Framework Laptop to develop on. I share what I liked and disliked and how I got on with it.

item.title: How to Set the Locale Used in Cypress Tests
item.description: When running some Cypress tests in Github Actions that were inspecting dates recently, I wanted to be able to set the locale of the browser

item.title: Should You Pay for Github Copilot?
item.description: Unless you’ve been hidden under a rock, you’re likely aware of Copilot - Github’s (or Microsofts) AI pair programmer. It allows you to get help on the code you’re writing by bringing up suggestions through an autocomplete snippets when you begin typing code in your editor.

Buying Refurbished Just isn't the Same for the M1 Pro

Rendering a Christmas Tree that Never Comes Down with p5.js
How to Code Christmas Tree LEDs (and find their 3D Coordinates)
item.description: For Christmas 2021, I decided to make our tree lights incredibly complex so that I could marvel at my own animations running on them. That's tongue and cheek, but also ended up being very true.

item.title: How to Setup Raspberry Pi OS: Bullseye like a Python Pro
Deleting Disqus Made My Blog Run 3x Faster
Automatic Static Site Creation with Astro, Supabase and Netlify
Comparing Low-Code Tools as a Developer
Build Your Own Pico Powered Midi Controller for $35
item.description: The Pico RGB keypad base from pimoroni is a DIY kit that takes the Raspberry Pi Pico and gives you an a 16 button matrix of rgb LEDs, ready to program however you like using MicroPython or CircuitPython.

item.title: Installing Module Extras with Pipenv and Poetry
Setting Up a New M1 Mac for Development
Comparing VAT Solutions for Bootstrapped UK Businesses
item.description: Laws on when to apply VAT have always been a complex beast - in 2015 the EU made changes that meant that VAT was to be calculated based on a customer location. Since leaving the EU things have become even more complicated if you happen to be based in the UK.

item.title: The Years I've Spent on Side Projects Have Not Been Wasted
Building a Cookiecutter Template for Multiple Python Package Managers
Bootstrapping Python Projects with Cookiecutter and Makefiles
What is a PEP and Why Should I Care?
item.description: No doubt if you’ve been developing in Python for any length of time, you will have heard the acronym “PEP” mentioned quite frequently. More often than not you hear it when talking about Python code style, usually followed by the number “8”. So what is a PEP and why should you care?
